file_content.text: Captain! Marshall Cavarat just told me you apparently single-handedly recaptured Ivory and put half the Imperial presence in the prison to rest.
But did Ivory tell you anything? Helping the Republic recapture prisoners they couldn't hold in the first place wasn't really the point.
Ivory accepted--leniency from the Republic in return for Rogun's known safe houses.
I made the deal.
Captain. I just got a less-than-glowing report from Marshall Cavarat. What kind of mess did you get into down there?
And more importantly, did you get anything from Ivory? I've outed half a dozen of Rogun's assassins on Port Nowhere--he's really gunning for us.
Ivory gave me a list of Rogun's old bolt-holes to check out.
I've got some targets.
Excellent.
Ivory and I worked out an arrangement.
It's done.
Turns out Rogun's the one who put Ivory behind bars. We're working together to get his revenge.
Ivory's with me now.
I told you the Republic only authorized--
Oh, drop the act. You want Rogun as much as I do.
With what Ivory gave me, we should be able to corner him.
Let's get Rogun.
Send over whatever Ivory gave you. I'll see if I recognize anything.
Nothing's ringing any bells. I'll dig a little further.
In the meantime, Captain, I'll work on those permits you'll need to land on Voss. I haven't slept a night since those awful beasts attacked.
Uh-oh, Captain. Better get off the line. We've got a distress call coming...
